Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of the Azure Load Balancer. Investigate any anomalies or potential issues.
Ensure that the backend pool is correctly configured and all instances are healthy. Verify that the pool aligns with the intended architecture.
Review and validate load balancing rules to ensure proper distribution of traffic and adherence to security policies.
Perform regular audits of NSGs associated with the Load Balancer to ensure compliance with security policies and best practices.
Perform failover tests to verify that the Load Balancer can handle traffic rerouting during outages or disruptions.
Review and update security policies related to the Load Balancer to adapt to changes in the network or security landscape.
Analyze performance metrics and optimize Load Balancer settings to ensure efficient traffic distribution and minimal latency.
Regularly back up Load Balancer configurations to ensure quick recovery in case of accidental changes or failures.
Keep documentation related to the Load Balancer up-to-date, including operational procedures, configuration details, and troubleshooting guides.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or Load Balancer outages. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Evaluate the SLA performance of the Load Balancer connectivity provider. Address any issues or deviations from the agreed SLA metrics.
Develop and execute plans for Load Balancer upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Load Balancer features, best practices, and security measures.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Load Balancer performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
